10th Annual Bioengineering Day

May 19th, 2016 at the Biocom Institute


REGISTER NOW

Bioengineering Day is a celebration of the department, its current research by faculty and students, and the field of bioengineering itself.

The event will feature senior design projects, a keynote speaker, graduate student presentations, speed networking, and the exciting Quiz Bowl. This upcoming BE Day is particularly special as it will be the kick-off event of the Bioengineering Department's 50th Anniversary Celebration. Expect an extensive amount of visiting alumni, researchers, and professionals to learn from and also to meet. It's going to be unforgettable!

Jessica Lam
President | jtl005@ucsd.edu

Hello friends! I'm a 4th Year Bioengineering: Biotechnology student. I'm a huge foodie, but ramen and Thai food are the faves. If you're ever down to get some yummy food off campus (because we all know dorm food isn't that good), feel free to hit me up! I also enjoy going to the beach when I'm not suffering indoors by studying, and really just exploring all that San Diego has to offer. I also enjoy going to concerts and (window) shopping! I'm also a barista, so stop by Cups Coffee and I'll be sure to make you a delicious cup of coffee. If you ever have any questions about BMES, classes, or just life, I'm open to it all!

Michelle Ragsac
Vice-President Internal | mragsac@ucsd.edu

I'm a 3rd year Bioengineering: Bioinformatics major, and I will be acting as this year's Vice-President Internal! I want to help the members of BMES learn about the opportunities avaliable to them, and contribute to providing a fun environment to study, socialize, contribute, and learn in our organization. In my spare time--when I'm not coding, eating, or reading--I like casual photography (especially of photos of my friends and food), dreaming about owning a cat, and sleeping. Send me a message if you have questions about Bioinformatics, UC San Diego life, food spots around campus, or how you can get involved in BMES!

Event Location

This year's event will be held at Biocom, a member-driven organization which supports the Southern California life sciences community through a diverse range of initiatives and programs.

Heading North on I-5

  • Exit Genesee Ave
  • Turn left onto Genesee Ave
  • Continue on Genesee (becomes N Torrey Pines Road)
  • Turn right on Science Park Road
  • Turn left on Torreyana Road
  • We are located on the left at 10996 Torreyana Road

Heading South on I-5

  • Exit Genesee Ave
  • Turn right onto Genesee Ave
  • Continue on Genesee (becomes N Torrey Pines Road)
  • Turn right on Science Park Road
  • Turn left on Torreyana Road
  • We are located on the left at 10996 Torreyana Road
